intro: Pilosella adenogaliciana, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and spoon-shaped, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense, button-like inflorescences. Pilosella adenogaliciana is often found in mountainous habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
